newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan oil industry investment seen falling - survey.
newsitem.headline: Japan oil industry investment seen falling - survey.

text.p: Japanese oil firms expect their capital investment in fiscal 1997/98, starting on April 1, to fall 1.6 percent from the current year to a combined 276.7 billion yen, a survey by an economic daily said on Wednesday.
The Nihon Keizai Shimbun survey of 14 oil firms said they expect their capital investment in 1996/97 to total a combined 281.2 billion yen, down 15.8 percent from the previous year.
Japan's oil industry is striving to cut costs amid tough competition brought on by last April's liberalisation of oil product imports.
